title: Emma Stone Reacts to 'Moonlight' Win Over 'La La Land'
text:
Emma Stone Reacts to 'Moonlight' Win Over 'La La Land' Most Popular By Antonia Blyth Feb 27, 2017 In what will surely go down as one of the most shocking moments in Oscar history, bits and pieces of what on earth happened to allow Warren Beatty to read the wrong Best Picture Oscar winner are starting to emerge. When Emma Stone realizes the twist ending #Oscars #BestPicture pic.twitter.com/nkm1nDLnmE 
— Marion Maitland (@nadatostada) February 27, 2017 Advertisement - Continue Reading Below For starters, in the press room, Emma Stone, who won the Oscar for Best Actress for her performance in La La Land , told reporters, "I was holding my best actress in a leading role card that entire time," Stone told reporters backstage. "So I don't mean to start stuff, but whatever story that was, I had that card. So I'm not sure what happened and I really wanted to talk to you guys first. Congratulations Moonlight ." Most Popular Emma Stone backstage: "I was also holding my Best Actress card at that time ... I don’t know what happened." #Oscars pic.twitter.com/FS11XVo11y 
— Hollywood Reporter (@THR) February 27, 2017 No one is quite sure what happened yet, as footage from the show reveals that Beatty was holding an envelope which read "Best Actress in a Leading Role." "Actress in a leading role" - who handed that to poor Warren Beatty. Feel so sorry for him. #Oscars pic.twitter.com/0bFg2m5v6M 
— Aaron Vallely (@Vallmeister) February 27, 2017 But Stone said she was thrilled to cede the win to Moonlight , Stone enthusiastically said, "I fucking love Moonlight . God I love Moonlight so much. I'm so excited for Moonlight. Of course you know it was an amazing thing to hear La La Land, I think we would have all loved to have won best picture but we are so excited for Moonlight, I think its one of the best films of all time so I was pretty beside myself." ELLE.com asked how everyone was faring after the huge mix-up. "I think everyone's in a state of confusion still," she said, "excitement but confusion." More from ELLE:
